text.section: Within 10 days after receiving a decision under § 5-212 of this subtitle, a complainant may appeal the decision in writing to the Secretary.

Within 30 days after an appeal is received:
the Coordinator:
shall review the complaint and the decision being appealed;
may conduct any necessary investigation; and
shall recommend to the Secretary or designee a finding of whether a violation of this subtitle has occurred; and
the Secretary or designee shall:
take the action described in subsection (c)(1) or (c)(2) of this section; and
issue to the parties a written decision that includes notice of any remedial action taken.

section.section: If the Secretary or designee determines that a violation has not occurred, the Secretary or designee shall dismiss the complaint.
If the Secretary or designee determines that a violation has occurred, the Secretary or designee shall take appropriate remedial action.

text.section: The decision of the Secretary or designee is final.
